Package com.kmfahey.jgameoflife.altthreadedimpl

Class CellGridSection

java.lang.Object
com.kmfahey.jgameoflife.altthreadedimpl.CellGridSection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class CellGridSection extends Object implements Runnable
This class implements a portion of the composite cell grid maintained by the CellGrid object. It stores instance variables that enable it to report where in the composite cell grid its region is located, and it stores all eight of its neighboring CellGridSection objects so that it can complete calculations of the sum of neighboring cells for cells located on the edge or in the corner of the region of the cells grid that it maintains.
See Also:
  • CellGrid
  • CellGridDispatch

    • modeFlagQueue

  • Constructor Details

    • CellGridSection

      public CellGridSection(int cellsWidth, int cellsHeight, int originHorizCoordVal, int originVertCoordVal)
      This method initializes the CellGridSection object, setting instance variables.
      Parameters:
      cellsWidth - The width of the portion of the cells grid that's been delegated to this object, in cells.
      cellsHeight - The height of the portion of the cells grid that's been delegated to this object, in cells.
      originHorizCoordVal - The horizontal coordinate of the upper left corner of this object's cells grid in the composite cells grid it is a part of.
      originVertCoordVal - The vertical coordinate of the upper left corner of this object's cells grid in the composite cells grid it is a part of.
      See Also:
      • CellGrid

  • Method Details

    • setModeFlagQueue

      public void setModeFlagQueue(ArrayBlockingQueue<Integer> modeFlagQueueVar)
      This method is used by CellGridDispatch to set the modeFlagQueue instance variable. This 1-capacity queue is used by CellGridDispatch to convey one of the constants MODE_CLEAR, MODE_SEED, MODE_UPDATE, or MODE_DISPLAY. The run() method removes that value from the queue to signal the work has begun, and replaces it with the constant FINISHED when the task is complete. The CellGridDispatch object in the main thread removes that value while it is wrapping up the execution of the task,
      Parameters:
      modeFlagQueueVar - The 1-capacity queue used to communicate mode flags back and forth between this object's run() method in a worker thread and CellGridDispatch running in the main thread.
      See Also:
      • CellGridDispatch

    • setMonitors

      public void setMonitors(Object mainToThreadsMonitorObj, Object threadsToMainMonitorObj)
      This method is used to set the two monitor objects that are used to signal and be signalled by the CellGridDispatch object running in the main thread.
      Parameters:
      mainToThreadsMonitorObj - The monitor object that CellGridDispatch in the main thread calls notifyAll() on and this object in a worker thread calls wait() on.
      threadsToMainMonitorObj - The monitor object that CellGridDispatch in the main thread calls wait() on and this object in a worker thread calls notify() on.
      See Also:
      • CellGridDispatch

    • setNeighbor

      public void setNeighbor(CellGridSection neighborGrid, int dirFlag)
      This method is used to set one of the 8 {compassDirection}Neighbor instance variables to another CellGridSection object. When used for all 8 compass directions, this enables this CellGridSection object to keep track of its neighbors so it can complete the cellular automata"s neighbors calculation when the center cell lies on an edge or in a corner of this object's portion of the composite cells grid.
      Parameters:
      neighborGrid - The neighboring CellGridSection object.
      dirFlag - One of the constants NORTH, NORTHEAST, EAST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTH, SOUTHWEST, WEST, or NORTHWEST.
      See Also:
      • CellGridDispatch

    • run

      public void run()
      This method implements the run() method called for by the Runnable interface, and is the method that's called by the Thread object that's instantiated around this CellGridSection object by CellGridDispatch. In order to keep the thread persistent during the indefinite period of the automata, it contains an infinite loop and never returns. During the execution, it uses a pair of monitor objects to start and stop execution, and passes signal int values back and forth with the main thread run from CellGridDispatch using an ArrayBlockingQueue<Integer>.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • clearCellGrid

      public void clearCellGrid()
      This method clears the displayCells array by setting every value in it to 0.

    • seedCellGrid

      public void seedCellGrid()
      This method populates the displayCells array with randomly chosen 1 values in order to spontaneously create cellular automata before or during the automata execution. Roughly 1 in 8 cells are set to 1, regardless of their previous setting.

    • getHorizDim

      public int getHorizDim()
      This method is an accessor for the private horizDim variable.
      Returns:
      The int maxHoriz, the maximum value of the horizontal dimension of the displayCells array.

      public int[][] getDisplayCells()
      This method is an accessor for the private displayCells variable.
      Returns:
      The int[][] displayCells comprising the region of the composite cells grid that this object maintains.

    • algorithmUpdateStep

      public void algorithmUpdateStep()
      This method completes the first step of the 2-step algorithm execution process, computing the updateCells cell grid array's value from the neighbors of each cell in the displayCells cell grid array.

    • algorithmDisplayStep

      public void algorithmDisplayStep()
      This method completes the two-step algorithm by copying every cell from the buffer array updateCells into the display array displayCells.
